note.p: Research Field: Mechanics, ballistics, military and civil architecture

Career: Worked on the survey of the French meridian under Jacques Cassini (FRS 1698) (1718); Professor of Mathematics, Artillery School of La Fere; employed by the Prince de Dombes, Grand Master of Artillery, then by the Prince de Cond√©, who took him on campaign in Italy; Inspector of Artillery; Field Marshal; Royal Censor of mathematical works
Memberships: Academie Royale des Sciences; Berlin Academy
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DSB; Biographie Universelle
Notes: Proposed by James Jurin. DSB gives year of birth as 1697/8.
